page.title: 02FARMING AND MACHINE'S
page.content: THERE ARE TWO MAIN WAYS TO KEEP THE LAND FREE FROM DISEASE THE FARMER CAN SPRAY FROM A TRACTOR OR IF THE LAND IS TO WET TO USE A TRACTOR HE CAN SPRAY FROM THE AIR.ONCE ALL THE CROP'S HAVE BEEN CULTIVATED THE CROP'S ARE TRANSPORTED BY ROAD ON LORRY'S.A TYPICAL FARM WOULD OWN 1.BAILER 1.COMBINE HARVESTER 1.CRAWLER TRACTOR 12.WHEEL TRACTORS 2.FORKLIFT'S 1.SUGAR BEET HARVESTER 1.POTATOE HARVESTER. THESE MACHINE'S NOW DO THE WORK OF THIRTY MEN.THE LAND IN THIS AREA IS UNDER SEA LEVEL THE RIVER WITHAM WHICH FLOW'S THOUGH THIS AREA IS HIGHER THAN THE LAND SO ALL FIELD'S IN THE AREA HAVE DYKE'S ROUND,ALL THE FIELD'S ARE DRAINED AND THE WATER IS PUMPED OUT OF THE AREA AND BACK TO BOSTON THIS IS COMMON ALL OVER LINCONSHIRE AS THE LAND IS SO FLAT.
